ideas.title: ASA Data Loop Proof — Content Series
ideas.description: Turn the ASA AU campaign refinement story into 3-part creator content: (1) Why your keyword research was wrong (theory/gut fail), (2) What the data actually showed (exact match winners), (3) How coaches fix their own assumptions.
specific_targets: Youth sports AI crowd (Product Hunt, IndieHackers)
draft_hooks: Post 1: 'We tested 30 basketball keywords. 13 had zero impressions. Here's what actually works.' (carousel with keyword chart)
Post 2: 'Your instinct about what coaches search is probably wrong. (So was ours.)'
Post 3: 'The coaches winning with data always ask the same question first: What does the live campaign actually say?'
ideas.implementation: Write 3 carousel posts + 1 long-form (LinkedIn) via Haiku templates. Deploy to /content/blog/aaa-data-wins. Commit to repo. Publish via HubSpot calendar.
ideas.why_matters_series_b: Demonstrates: (1) How CourtLab coaches learn to trust data over gut, (2) Real campaign iteration (not theory), (3) Founder humility + data discipline = investor confidence.

ideas.title: courtlabops.vercel.app — Add 'Coach Wins' Feed Widget
ideas.description: New homepage section: Auto-fetching coach success stories ("Marcus upgraded 2 underrated players," "Team +12% shooting after 6-week streak," "Scout feedback validated by stats.") Creates engagement loop + testimonial goldmine + traction proof.
specific_targets: Series B investors reviewing product differentiation
draft_implementation: Step 1: Create /components/WinsCarousel.jsx (3 rotating wins, each 30s auto-advance)
Step 2: Add API endpoint /api/coach-wins (mock 5 wins for now, link to form for real submissions)
Step 3: Create inline 'Submit your win' button → Google Form → auto-add to DB
Step 4: Deploy to staging, test responsive (mobile first), merge to main
ideas.why_matters_series_b: Proof of adoption + engagement. Shows coaches are winning real outcomes (talent ID, skill improvement, scout validation). Counters 'nice product, but do coaches actually use it?' question.
ideas.time_estimate: 1.5-2 hours (quick React, mock data, form integration)
ideas.design_notes: Card-based, 3-card carousel. Dark theme (match site). Real names + skill tags + outcome metrics.
